title: how to Configure ISO Image for Each SRM VMs

messages.content: how to Configure ISO Image for Each SRM VMs

To configure an ISO image for each SRM VM, follow these steps:

1. Log in to the vCenter Client and select the VMs.
2. Power off the VM.
3. Right-click the VMs and click Edit Settings.
4. In the Virtual Hardware tab, click on ADD NEW DEVICE, point the CD/DVD Drive 2 setting to DataStore ISO File.
5. Expand the CD/DVD Drive 2 option to display the CD/DVD Media location, then click Browse.
6. Go to the data store in which the ISO image is stored and select the ISO image.
7. Click OK to close the Browse window.

This procedure reconfigures SRM VMs (vApp based) to use an attached ISO image for OS upgrade initiation.

messages.content: how to Configure ISO Image for Each SRM VMs

To configure an ISO image for each SRM VM, follow these exact steps as written in the context:

1. Log in to the Frontend Appliance and navigate to `/opt/ADG/osupdate/logs` directory.
2. Check the `osUpgradeInitiation.log` for below error for all the servers.
3. Go to the data store in which the ISO image is stored, then select the ISO image.
4. After ISO Image attachment, rerun the command: `SLESOSupgrade.sh -u remoteServer`
5. The script will initiate the Operating System upgrade on the Failed Servers.

Note that steps 1-2 are part of troubleshooting the failed OS upgrade initiation, and not part of configuring the ISO image directly.

messages.content: how to Configure ISO Image for Each SRM VMs

To configure an ISO image for each SRM VMs, follow these steps:

1. Log in to the Frontend Appliance and navigate to /opt/ADG/osupdate/logs directory.
2. Check the osUpgradeInitiation.log for below error for all the servers.

3. If an ISO image is attached:
   After ISO Image attachment, rerun the following command: SLESOSupgrade.sh -u remoteServer
4. If no ISO image is attached:
   Follow the steps mentioned in Configure ISO Image for Each SRM VMs (section title).

Steps to follow when an ISO image is not attached:

1. Log in to the Frontend Appliance and navigate to /opt/ADG/osupdate/logs directory.
2. Check the osUpgradeInitiation.log for below error for all the servers.

3. After ISO Image attachment, rerun the following command:
   SLESOSupgrade.sh -u remoteServer

4. Follow the steps mentioned in Configure ISO Image for Each SRM VMs (refer to original context) when an ISO image is not attached.

Note: Command details are provided in the original context and do not need to be included in this refined answer.

messages.content: how to Configure ISO Image for Each SRM VMs

To configure an ISO image for each SRM VM, follow these steps:

1. Log in to the vCenter Client and select the VMs.
2. Power off the VM.
3. Right-click the VMs and click Edit Settings.
4. In the Virtual Hardware tab, click on ADD NEW DEVICE, point the CD/DVD Drive 2 setting to DataStore ISO File.
5. Expand the CD/DVD Drive 2 option to display the CD/DVD Media location, then click Browse.
6. Go to the data store in which the ISO image is stored and select the ISO image.
7. Click OK to close the Browse window.

8. Select Connect At Power On option for CD/DVD Drive 2.
9. Click OK on the Edit Settings pane to close the window and reconfigure the VMs settings.
10. Check the Recent Tasks pane of the vCenter Client to confirm that the VMs are reconfigured successfully.
11. Power on the VM.

This will enable the ISO image attachment for each SRM VM, allowing you to initiate the Operating System upgrade process.

messages.content: please remove this thinking-indicator Just show text Thinking

To remove the ISO image deployed for the Operating System upgrade, follow these steps:

1. Log in to the vCenter Client and select the VM.
2. Shut down the VM.
3. Right-click on the VM and click Edit Settings.
4. Remove the ISO image from the list of virtual hardware devices.

Note: The specific procedure steps are exactly as written in the context, without any added or assumed information.
